■ Children 6–59 months of age with moderate acute malnutrition need to receive 
nutrient-dense foods to meet their extra needs for weight and height gain and 
functional recovery.
Rationale and evidence
Moderate acute malnutrition in children is defined as a weight-for-height between -3 and -2 
z-scores of the median of the WHO child growth standards without oedema. Globally, about 40 
million preschool-age children meet these criteria.
